intro: Coccocypselum spicatum, commonly known as the spiny coccocypselum, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its spiny stems and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are alternate and ovate, often with a hairy texture. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in open woodlands or along riverbanks.
